text.section:
In this section, "excess charges" means an amount, in excess of the estimate provided to a consumer, charged by a household goods mover for additional services that:
Are provided before or during an intrastate move; and
Are necessary because of circumstances that:
Are beyond the control of the household goods mover; and
Could not have been reasonably anticipated by the household goods mover.
Subject to subsection (e) of this section, a household goods mover shall provide a written estimate to a consumer before providing household goods moving services for an intrastate move.

section.section: A consumer who receives a binding estimate from a household goods mover may not be required to pay more than the estimated total price stated in the estimate for the household goods moving services described in the estimate.

A consumer who receives a nonbinding estimate from a household goods mover may not be required to pay more than 125% of the estimated total price stated in the estimate for the household goods moving services described in the estimate, plus any applicable excess charges.

text.section: A consumer may waive the right to receive a written estimate under subsection (a) of this section if the waiver is made voluntarily and without coercion by the household goods mover.
